caption: Table A1: Comparison of computational costs across different methods. We report the mean value and (standard deviation) derived from 10 runs with different seeds.
description: This table compares the computational cost of different methods used for decision-aware active learning.  It shows the acquisition time (time to compute the next design) and total time (time to complete 10 rounds of design) for various methods including GP-RS, GP-US, GP-DUS, T-EIG, D-EIG, and TNDP (the authors' method). The results highlight that TNDP, being fully amortized, requires significantly less time than other methods which depend on iterative optimization and/or GP updates.  The values reported are means and standard deviations across 10 independent runs.

caption: Table A1: Comparison of computational costs across different methods. We report the mean value and (standard deviation) derived from 10 runs with different seeds.
description: This table compares the computational cost of various methods for decision-aware active learning, focusing on acquisition time (time to compute a single design) and total time (time for 10 design rounds). The results highlight the significantly faster inference times of the proposed Transformer Neural Decision Process (TNDP) method due to its full amortization, unlike other methods that require extensive computation for each step.
